title: UNM FIRST: Promoting Inclusive Excellence in Neuroscience and Data Science
explanation: The term "systemically" is used in the context of transforming institutional culture towards inclusive excellence, which aligns with social and political goals related to diversity and equity.

title: Effects of exogenous testosterone therapy on communication in gender diverse speakers
explanation: The term 'systemically' refers to a planned and methodical approach to testing the research model described in the grant proposal. It implies a structured investigation of the effects of testosterone therapy on communication.

title: Inclusive Graduate Programs: An AGEP Pilot in Physics
explanation: The term 'systemically' refers to how inequalities are embedded within the culture and structures of physics graduate programs, advantaging some groups over others. This speaks to social and political issues of equity, access, and power dynamics within the context of STEM education and opportunity, fitting the 'POLITICAL' classification.

title: ADVANCE Partnership: Leveraging Intersectionality and Engineering Affinity groups in Industrial Engineering and Operations Research (LINEAGE)
